meanings.definition: The action of integrating someone or something back into a group or system.
meanings.sent1: After his time away, the reintegration of the student into the classroom was smooth.
meanings.sent2: The reintegration of the lost puppy into the family brought joy to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The reintegration of the missing puzzle piece completed the picture perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The reintegration of the old book into the library shelves felt like a reunion.
meanings.sent5: The reintegration of the stray cat into the neighborhood was heartwarming.

meanings.definition: The process of restoring unity or harmony within a group or system.
meanings.sent1: The reintegration of the team after the conflict was crucial for their success.
meanings.sent2: The reintegration of different opinions led to a stronger decision-making process.
meanings.sent3: The reintegration of the out-of-tune instruments made the music sound much better.
meanings.sent4: The reintegration of the missing ingredient brought balance to the recipe.
meanings.sent5: The reintegration of the broken pieces created a beautiful mosaic.
